title: PSG chief Leonardo 'keen to poach Brazilian wonder-kid Lucas Paqueta from AC Milan'
text:
Paris Saint-Germain sporting director Leonardo is eager to bring AC Milan youngster Lucas Paqueta with him to the French capital, according to reports.

The Brazilian chief worked for AC Milan until the summer, brokering the deal to bring his young countryman from Flamengo to Milan in a £31million move in January.

Leonardo has since moved to PSG, and now Sky Sport Italia report that he wants Paqueta to follow him there in the coming months.

Lucas Paqueta has found game-time hard to come by for AC Milan, and PSG could be keen

Leonardo helped broker the deal to bring Paqueta (pictured) to AC Milan from Flamengo

Paqueta has found his playing time hard to come by in Serie A, first under Gennaro Gattuso and then under Marco Giampaolo.

There is a new man in charge in Stefano Pioli, which Paqueta will hope can be a fresh start for him, but a move away is a possibility in the coming months.

The 22-year-old has previously enjoyed playing in a creative midfield role, but has been increasingly used in a deeper holding position for the Rossoneri.
